column2: Job Description ? Monitoring and providing general care to patients on hospital wards and in outpatient clinics; ? Admitting patients requiring special care, followed by investigations and treatment; ? Examining and talking to patients to diagnose their medical conditions; ? Carrying out specific procedures, e.g. Performing operations and specialist investigations; ? Making notes and preparing paperwork, both as a legal record of treatment and for the benefit of other healthcare professionals; ? Working with other doctors as part of a team, either in the same department or within other specialties; ? Liaising with other medical and non-medical staff in the hospital to ensure quality treatment; ? Promoting health education; ? Undertaking managerial responsibilities such as planning the workload and staffing of the department, especially at more senior levels; ? Teaching and supervising junior doctors and medical students; ? Carrying out auditing and research.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Full Time Orthopedic Surgeon with high surgical and communication skills, should be able to "independently" handle trauma & 24x7 emergencies (which may arise off-duty hours as well) in an Ortho departments of multi-specialty hospitals at Meerut (UP) & Bhiwadi (Rajasthan) Desired Candidate Profile   DNB (Ortho) or MS (Ortho) candidates, from an Indian institute of repute, with 2 to 5 years of experience (post SR-ship) are preferred.  The candidate should be able to commit for a minimum period of 2 years  Knowledge of Hindi & English is must. Perks and Benefits   Fixed monthly salary + Revenue Based Incentives + hands-on training of Joint replacements & Arthroscopies.   Though these 2 vacancies are based out at Meerut (UP) & Bhiwadi (Rajasthan) only but it the Surgeon is keen, may have exposure to our other centres in 7 other states/UTs, including Robotic TKRs at our Delhi centre (Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj)

column2: Medigram Hospital  is looking for Consultant Orthopedic  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    As a Consultant in Orthopedics, you will be a key member of the healthcare team, specializing in the diagnosis, treatment, and management of musculoskeletal conditions     Your expertise in orthopedic medicine will contribute to improving the quality of life for patients by addressing a variety of orthopedic issues     This role requires strong clinical skills, surgical proficiency, and the ability to collaborate within a multidisciplinary healthcare setting       Responsibilities:       Patient Care: Provide comprehensive orthopedic care to patients, including diagnosis, treatment, and management of musculoskeletal disorders     Orthopedic Surgeries: Conduct and participate in orthopedic surgeries, including joint replacements, arthroscopic procedures, fracture repairs, and other orthopedic interventions     Clinical Assessments: Perform thorough clinical assessments, including physical examinations, imaging interpretation, and diagnostic tests, to formulate accurate diagnoses     Treatment Planning: Develop and implement personalized treatment plans for patients, considering both surgical and non-surgical options     Patient Education: Educate patients about their orthopedic conditions, treatment options, and postoperative care, fostering informed decision-making     Collaboration: Work collaboratively with other healthcare professionals, including physical therapists, nurses, and rehabilitation specialists, to ensure holistic patient care     Emergency Response: Be available for orthopedic consultations in emergency cases and trauma situations, providing timely and effective medical care     Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records, including patient histories, examination findings, and treatment plans     Quality Improvement: Participate in quality assurance initiatives to enhance orthopedic care delivery and patient outcomes     Continuing Education: Stay abreast of advancements in orthopedic medicine, surgical techniques, and rehabilitation methodologies through continuous education and professional development
column11: Quality improvement, Manager Quality Assurance, Surgical, Diagnostics, Orthopedics, Patient care, Healthcare, medical records, Management

column2: To initiate evaluation and treatment of patients, modify evaluation and treatment begun by junior medical colleagues in furtherance of the highest quality of patient care.  To participate in the general management and care of all patients including undertaking preliminary basis and routine investigations and treatment (pre-and post-operative care) under supervision.  To see all new cases especially the seriously ill patient immediately upon admission and to initiate emergency treatment without delay.  To ensure that all investigations and treatment prescribed are carried out and reviewing cases daily or more frequently including reviewing the results of investigations and treatments.  To oversee the proper documentation of patients management from admission to discharge.  To ensure clarity of plan of care for each patient is documented on a daily basis.  To prepare a comprehensive discharge summary for each patient which is authenticated by a consultant.  To update case notes and complete all case records within 24 hours of the patients discharge.    For inquiries, kindly reach out to - Mr. Ashish Kaushik, at 9999709839or at Ashish.kaushik@fortishealthcare.com

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Consultant Orthopedics Aster MIMS Kannur to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Evaluate patients with musculoskeletal conditions, to determine appropriate treatment options      Develop individualized treatment plans for patients, which may include medication, physical therapy, and surgery      Perform surgical procedures on the musculoskeletal system, such as joint replacement, spinal fusion, and fracture fixation      Monitor patients during surgery to ensure safe administration of anesthesia and identify any adverse reactions or complications      Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including physiotherapists and occupational therapists, to provide comprehensive care to patients with musculoskeletal conditions      Provide emergency care to patients who require urgent intervention, such as trauma victims or patients with acute medical conditions      Document patient care and maintain accurate records of surgical procedures, patient progress, and any adverse reactions or complications
column11: Surgical, Orthopedics, Patient care, Healthcare, Anesthesia, Physical therapy, Monitoring
